title: Rosin Claude Ngueveu

Education
Université du Québec à Montréal | Montréal, Qc | Canada
Ph.D. in Computer Science | Jan 2017 - June 2023 Advisors: Sébastien Gambs, Alain Tapp
Title: Fairness in Machine Learning through data preprocessing based on adversarial methods
Georgia Institute of Technology | Atlanta, GA | USA
Msc. in Electrical and Computer Engineering | Sept 2014 - May 2016
Université de Technologie de Troyes | Troyes | France Engineering degree in Network, System and Telecommunication: Mobile Technologies and Embedded Systems | Sept 2010 - May 2016

title: Rosin Claude Ngueveu
text:
Experience
Centre de Recherche Informatique de Montréal - (CRIM - Montreal, Qc, Canada.) | Data Privacy, Integrity and Ethics Analyst | Sep 2021 - Aug 2022

Contractor on data confidentiality
Integrity and ethics
Evaluation of service offers on the privacy and ethics dimensions
Formulation of recommendation for improved data management.

Laboratoire d’Analyse et d’Architecture des Systèmes - (LAAS-CNRS - Toulouse, France.) | Internet of Things vulnerability analyst | May 2015 - Oct 2015

Analysis, clarification of the Internet of Things and its relative concepts
Definition/Formalisation of criteria and classification methods
Deduction of attacks surfaces and potential vulnerabilities
Setup a django webserver to showcase analysis.

OPPIDA (Montigny-le-Bretonneux, France.) | Attacks Demonstrator | Feb 2014 - Jul 2014

Reverse Engineering of Industrial systems’ proprietary protocols
Analysis of PLC programs
Development of a platform for vulnerabilities demonstration and vulnerabilities Testing.

title: Rosin Claude Ngueveu
text:
Hello, thank you for dropping by.
I am a Research Scientist working on the topic of Fairness, Accountability and Transparency in machine learning. I have been working on methods focusing on the preprocessing of the dataset in order to remove unwanted correlations that have a negative impact in the decision making process. I completed my PhD at UQAM Under the Supervision of Sébastien Gambs and Alain Tapp. Before my PhD, I have been working and completing my Engineering studies in computer security and embedded systems.

title: Rosin Claude Ngueveu
text:
Research Interests
My current interests lye in Ethics of AI (Fairness, Explicability, Accountabilty) Privacy and Robustness in Machine Learning, and Computer Security. There are many intersections between these topics, creating exciting research topics and publications.

title: Research blog & Interest (In construction)
text:
Welcome to my blog focused on research and other interest. Concerning my research interest, you will find some discussions about my publications, some interesting papers and other notes or hacking challenges that I find interesting.
About my interest, they will mainly revolve around finance, photography & videography.

title: A general survey on fairness in machine learning : a focus on tabular datasets
text:
Fairness in machine learning is a very large research field where there are many definitions, metrics, orientations, methods and point of views.
In fact, since fairness is strongly related to social and societal issues, each impacted individual or society can have its own notion of what means fairness, and how it should be enforced.
In this blog post, we will provide a summary of our article “A general survey on fairness in machine learning : a focus on tabular datasets”.
